About Upgrading 5.3/6.0 Projects

To upgrade 5.3/6.0 projects to the new project format, copy them into project databases. Upgrading 5.3/6.0 projects allows you to access all Serena ChangeMan Version Manager features. You can also copy 5.3/6.0 project roots into new project databases.

NOTE If you want to upgrade a Version Manager Source Code Control (SCC) Interface 5.3/6.0 project, see the Serena ChangeMan Version Manager IDE Client Implementation Guide for your development environment for more information.

Default Options for 5.3/6.0 Project Upgrades

When you upgrade a 5.3/6.0 project, Version Manager:

  • Organizes the new project based on the structure of the existing 5.3/6.0 project and includes archives that are not in folders. These archives may be located at the project root level. This option is available only if you create the project based on the existing 5.3/6.0 project structure.

  • References the original archives in the existing archive locations. Copied folders will also reference their existing archive locations. When copying a project that contains multiple folders, remember that the folders may have different archive locations. The new project will reference all of the different archive locations.

    Note that any new archives added to the project after it is copied will use the project's archive location. The default is a directory named for the project beneath the archives directory of the project database location.

  • Copies the project's existing configuration files and places them in the new project's structure.

  • Uses the 5.3/6.0 project's existing access control databases.

You can override any of these defaults when copying a project.
